intro: Pabstiella elegans, commonly known as the elegant pabstiella, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae, although it is not a true cactus, exhibiting more herbaceous characteristics. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom during the cooler months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to its arid environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pabstiella elegans is considered a vulnerable species.
